item.title: New Site
item.description: New Site Welcome to the new SourceBans++ site, this site is meant to serve as a replacement to the old one, featuring a brand new documentation, and FAQ pages

item.title: Quickstart
item.description: Prerequisites Before we get started, let’s make sure you meet these following requirements: Web A working MySQL/MariaDB database PHP Version >= 5.6 Game Sourcemod >= 1.7 Metamod: Source If you’re using Cloudflare, Rocket Loader must be disabled otherwise SourceBans++ will become unresponsive. Uploading Download the latest release from the release page Upload everything that’s within web folder to either the root of your web server or a folder that you wish to allocate Upload everything that’s within game to the game mod directory (tf, cs, dod, etc) Write Permission config.

item.title: Inquiries
item.description: Plugin Ban player option is missing in SourceMod’s admin menu! Most likely SourceMod’s basebans.smx was still loaded when you installed SourceBans’ game plugin. The game plugin automatically disables basebans.smx, but your server needs to be restarted for the “Ban player” option to come available. Some hosters might disallow plugins to move files. Make sure the basebans.smx is in the plugins/disabled folder. Web Player list displays “Max Players” instead of all the players Add host_players_show 2 to your server.

item.title: Updating
item.description: Downloading Download the latest zip-archive from the release page Web Panel Backup your database in case of corruption Switch back to the default theme if haven’t already Upload and overwrite all contents in web to your SourceBans++ installation Delete install directory Navigate to your SourceBans++ website and append updater after it (Ex: example.com/updater, example.com/sb/updater) After it displays Installation up-to-date., delete updater directory and you are done Plugin Upload and overwrite all contents in game to your root game directory (Ex: tf, cs, etc) Reconfigure the config files in addons/sourcemod/configs/sourcebans/ Ensure everything is running smooth, and you are done Plugin (Upgrading from version <= 1.

item.title: Database Errors
item.description: Access Denied If not self-hosted, please make sure your host allows remote connections This problem is often related to user accounts that the server permits View MariaDB #Granting for more info Can’t connect to MySQL server Normally means that there is no MySQL server running on the system or that you are using an incorrect Unix socket file name or TCP/IP port number when trying to connect to the server.

item.title: Debugging Connection
item.description: Check list Your host is not blocking any traffic on your game server port (UDP Incoming & TCP Outgoing) Your game server is online to people outside of your network w/o any error on binding You can connect to server in-game You can use RCON through in-game console, if not view TCP Error below Using the debug tool In SourceBans++’s root directory, there’s a connection debug tool named sb_debug_connection.

item.title: MariaDB
item.description: Adding Repo sudo apt-get install software-properties-common sudo apt-key adv --recv-keys --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 0xF1656F24C74CD1D8 sudo add-apt-repository 'deb [arch=amd64,i386,ppc64el] http://nyc2.mirrors.digitalocean.com/mariadb/repo/10.2/ubuntu xenial main' sudo apt-get update Installing sudo apt-get install mariadb-server Setup Run mysql_secure_installation Configuring Navigate to your MariaDB config (Ex: /etc/mysql/mariadb.conf.d/50-server.cnf) Comment out bind-address by prefixing it with a #, so it looks like #bind-address = 127.0.0.1 Restart MySQL via sudo systemctl restart mysql Granting Permission Sign in to MySQL shell via sudo mysql -u root -p and enter your password

item.title: Adding Server
item.description: Adding server to web panel Navigate to Admin Panel -> Server Settings -> Add new server Fill out the information about the server with correct RCON Password and click Add Server when done On refresh, record down the ID column for the corresponding server Configuring SourceBans++’s ServerID Navigate to addons/sourcemod/configs/sourcebans Edit sourcebans.cfg and modify ServerID to the ID value you recorded down Save, reupload file, and reload map/restart server

item.title: Could not find driver "MySQL"
item.description: Debugging Please make sure dbi.mysql.ext.so (dbi.mysql.ext.dll on Windows) extension exists and check if it is loaded via sm exts list Make sure the extension is executable via chmod u+x dbi.mysql.ext.so Install zlib (Requires SSH Access) 32-Bit Debian/Ubuntu: apt-get install zlib1g 64-Bit Debian/Ubuntu: apt-get install lib32z1 32⁄64-Bit Fedora: yum install zlib.i686 32⁄64-Bit Mandriva: urpmi zlib1 32-Bit SUSE: zypper install libz1 64-Bit SUSE: zypper install libz1-32bit If all of the above does not work, use ldd -d -r dbi.

item.title: Removing Default Message
item.description: Removal Navigate to Admin Panel -> Webpanel Settings Edit the Intro Text Save Changes and you are done

item.title: Browser Freeze
item.description: Cloudflare If your site uses Cloudflare as reverse-proxy, make sure that Rocket Loader is off Rocket Loader bundles mootools incorrect and cause unnecessary loop calls Debugging Most browsers bundles with a performance debugger, typically accessible via the hotkey F12 With the performance recorder open, start recording, navigate to the unresponsive page, end the recording after ~10 seconds and export it Join our Discord guild and post in #help-support with the exported performance file attached
